blog.footer:
About

Printscreen is a Plated^ component. It started as a simple lua script to allow screenshots to be uploaded to a website.

Back then (2007!) when it was called, 'sBlog', we had to jump through a few hoops to get this to work. Ultimately, we settled on the simplest and most obvious method - sending a message containing the screenshot using a Gmail account. This worked with any blogging service that supported email hosting which included Flickr, Blogger and Livejournal.

Printscreen is on Github

Click z to zoom, right arrow and left arrow key to navigate.

hi!
BACK TO TOP

blog/2017-04-14-21-40-20-galigali-shi._blog_post_body: first iteration of the printscreen layout. i have a huge suspicion it will stay like this for a while. until i change it, of course.

_blog_post_json.author: shi
_blog_post_json.title: shi at Fri Apr 14 21:40:20 UTC 2017 on galigali

blog/2017-04-14-22-51-19-galigali-shi._blog_post_body: Went through considerable lengths to source the actual sounds of the instruments we play in the game. Finally found a reputable source from the depths of The Early Music Shop; going through countless samples, finding the right ones and trimming the chosen ones to a single note. I was going to go one further and make it play a certain tune, depending on which characters you mouse over but felt that might be a tad overkill. Is it though?

_blog_post_json.author: shi

Oh and a a temporary logo has replaced the navigation bar, at least for now.

_blog_post_json.author: shi

blog/2017-05-16-07-12-53-fatso-kriss._blog_post_body: Load and save of window layout, seems like a useful thing. Still not sure how all this is going to work :)

blog/2017-05-24-14-31-03-fatso-kriss._blog_post_body: Making ears look more like, ears. For some reason I am very happy that it works from the back with a bald head.

_blog_post_json.author: kriss
_blog_post_json.title: kriss at Wed 24 May 14:31:03 BST 2017 on fatso

blog/2017-05-31-13-45-03-fatso-kriss._blog_post_body: Slowly modeling and adding in body parts, turns out twisting eyesocket bones to deform a face can add a lot of character.

_blog_post_json.author: kriss

blog/2017-06-16-16-44-43-fatso-kriss._blog_post_body: So it turns out any low poly 3d rendered at 320x240 with crt effects looks like it belongs on a Playstation or PS1 as I believe the kids call them nowadays.

_blog_post_json.author: kriss

blog/2017-08-06-18-15-39-ripley-shi._blog_post_body: You can now edit and run #fun64 code in the browser - it should cache whatever you type forever and ever, unless you clear it :}

_blog_post_json.title: shi at Sun  6 Aug 18:15:39 BST 2017 on ripley

blog/2017-08-10-22-58-19-fatso-kriss._blog_post_body:
The background copper layer of Fun64 lets you use shaders built in shadertoy. Which is nice and easy for testing and development and very much the modern equivalent of what you could do in a copperlist.

https://xriss.github.io/fun64/pad/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fgist.github.com%2Fxriss%2F90f8c1d2e9cb0b9d307fe68aebb4b9c3

In spirit anyway.

_blog_post_json.author: shi

blog/2017-09-10-14-32-41-ripley-shi._blog_post_body: More neon, as promised, in the #fun64 FunPad. Not nearly as much as I'd like but it's getting there. Still figuring out what to put in there that will not confuse people so it's a work in progress.

blog/2017-09-30-11-21-04-ripley-shi._blog_post_body: Finally added sound to the #fun64 engine - aptly named, Swanky Beep. Simple wave and frequency modulation, stress testing it in #Coderdojo.

_blog_post_json.author: shi

blog/2017-12-28-10-43-35-ripley-shi._blog_post_body: plated^ documentation template using plated^. Had a few goes before being deciding on this layout and colour theme - usually preferring the darker colours as they are less harsh to the eyes. For this purpose however, a brighter template is more suited to documentation and reading.

_blog_post_json.author: shi
_blog_post_json.title: shi at Thu 28 Dec 10:43:35 GMT 2017 on ripley

blog/2018-01-01-16-51-50-ripley-shi._blog_post_body: Had some time to update the plated^ site - good timing too, considering the last time (or rather, the first time) we did this was at the beginning of the previous year :}

_blog_post_json.author: shi
_blog_post_json.title: shi at Mon  1 Jan 16:51:50 GMT 2018 on ripley

blog/2018-01-13-12-59-59-ripley-shi._blog_post_body: Figuring out some styles for avatars to be used in dialogue boxes for our latest roguelike. At the same time, stress testing the latest version of #swankypaint - there were some issues with Intel graphics drivers that were causing the application to fail at startup but this is now fixed. Don't forget to opt in to the BETA branch on Steam :}

_blog_post_json.author: shi
_blog_post_json.title: shi at Sat 13 Jan 12:59:59 GMT 2018 on ripley

blog/2018-01-13-15-53-39-ripley-shi._blog_post_body: The not quite elusive Swanky32 palette with all its numbers and names.

_blog_post_json.author: shi
_blog_post_json.title: shi at Sat 13 Jan 15:53:39 GMT 2018 on ripley

blog/2018-01-13-16-08-26-ripley-shi._blog_post_body: We finally have avatars in the dialogue boxes :} There needs some considerable layout decisions to make it look less terrible, tho there will be a compromise in code base simplicity. Regardless, something needs to be done to make it less ugly.

_blog_post_json.author: shi
_blog_post_json.title: shi at Sat 13 Jan 16:08:26 GMT 2018 on ripley

blog/2018-01-14-22-03-57-ripley-shi._blog_post_body: Pixel hunting a body for the avatars. With such limitations, it's quite a challenge to fit all the details I'd have liked to without compromising variety. May stretch the widths of the characters but this might come at a price when animating.

_blog_post_json.author: shi
_blog_post_json.title: shi at Sun 14 Jan 22:03:57 GMT 2018 on ripley

blog/2018-01-14-22-54-27-ripley-shi._blog_post_body: The characters a littered about the level to see how they fit. We now have borders for the dialogue boxes :} This will allow some nice visual feedback like different borders for different groups of characters.

_blog_post_json.author: shi
_blog_post_json.title: shi at Sun 14 Jan 22:54:27 GMT 2018 on ripley

blog/2018-01-16-19-24-56-ripley-shi._blog_post_body: Eyes are crossed squinting at the screen - a different pixel here, another pixel there makes an eyeball or an xtra head. I've currently kept animation frames to a minimum but that's enough to create an acceptable breathing sequence. All of the characters have the same treatment for now but that should change later.

_blog_post_json.author: shi
_blog_post_json.title: shi at Tue 16 Jan 19:24:56 GMT 2018 on ripley

blog/2018-01-29-23-25-31-ripley-shi._blog_post_body: wakey wakey :} Have started writing down some semblance of a story and conversation. I'm trying to take it slow but it's hard when one is excited. Still, it is a little slow moving in terms of direction but there was some research done today - mostly on the background folklore so there is officially progress.

_blog_post_json.author: shi
_blog_post_json.title: shi at Mon 29 Jan 23:25:31 GMT 2018 on ripley

blog/2018-01-30-13-11-28-ripley-shi._blog_post_body: Trying out different tile sets to partition sections and different spaces using 3 colours. You can get a myriad of patterns that fit together nicely without looking too samey.

_blog_post_json.author: shi
_blog_post_json.title: shi at Tue 30 Jan 13:11:28 GMT 2018 on ripley

blog/2018-01-31-01-10-25-ripley-shi._blog_post_body: Going tile crazy. Hundreds more to go ;_;

_blog_post_json.author: shi
_blog_post_json.title: shi at Wed 31 Jan 01:10:25 GMT 2018 on ripley

blog/2018-02-01-23-31-16-ripley-shi._blog_post_body: Lots of green - those hedges need trimming.

_blog_post_json.author: shi
_blog_post_json.title: shi at Thu  1 Feb 23:31:16 GMT 2018 on ripley

blog/2018-03-31-23-34-33-ripley-shi._blog_post_body: Flexing old graphic design skills for a concert flyer I'm performing in. Took quite a while for the ol' noggin to get going but when it did, it wouldn't let me stop. Having literally forced myself to stop, there are now just 25 iterations to choose from (all of which I'm not really satisfied with - no surprises there!) - should prolly whittle it down to 5 or something :}

_blog_post_json.author: shi
_blog_post_json.title: shi at Sat 31 Mar 23:34:33 BST 2018 on ripley

blog/2018-07-12-16-55-04-ripley-shi._blog_post_body: New IT Stuff redesign using our new web framework, ^plated. The old server died and became unreliable (we've now moved server and upgraded for less!) so everything went with it. Our previous framework (pagecake) allowed you to edit stuff on the go but it also meant backups were manual which was not ideal. We've learnt a lot from a decade of using the system extensively so ^plated is the end result of all those years.

_blog_post_json.author: shi
_blog_post_json.title: shi at Thu 12 Jul 16:55:04 BST 2018 on ripley

blog/2018-07-12-16-59-07-ripley-shi._blog_post_body: I'm using <audio> tags for all the media in the blog posts and leaving the browser to style it. Seems to be the 'safest'.

_blog_post_json.author: shi
_blog_post_json.title: shi at Thu 12 Jul 16:59:07 BST 2018 on ripley

blog/2018-07-12-18-35-16-ripley-shi._blog_post_body: A quick design of a new podcast project - looking to play mostly with type for this.

_blog_post_json.author: shi
_blog_post_json.title: shi at Thu 12 Jul 18:35:16 BST 2018 on ripley

blog/2018-07-12-18-37-14-ripley-shi._blog_post_body: Current version of the 'doing it wrong' site. Still not happy with it, looks too busy or possibly not enough. May throw everything out and try again tho am quite happy with the logo - that, i might keep :}

_blog_post_json.author: shi
_blog_post_json.title: shi at Thu 12 Jul 18:37:14 BST 2018 on ripley

blog/2018-07-15-00-47-15-ripley-shi._blog_post_body: Producing my monthly weirdspace programme for Campfr - this one being my tenth, i've created an intro and outro for the show, finally using the cello and layered vocals. Mildly happy with the intro but that outro needs a lot more work :}

_blog_post_json.author: shi
_blog_post_json.title: shi at Sun 15 Jul 00:47:15 BST 2018 on ripley

blog/2018-07-16-20-43-16-ripley-shi._blog_post_body: New icons for new tools. The last time this was updated, we were still using mercurial as version control and a legacy version of inkscape. Eeps.

_blog_post_json.author: shi
_blog_post_json.title: shi at Mon 16 Jul 20:43:16 BST 2018 on ripley

blog/2018-07-16-21-40-47-ripley-shi._blog_post_body: We're both currently in full development mode to bring Swanky Paint to her latest version, Alpha +11. It's a huge update with many features, bug fixes and most notably, a rehaul of the user interface design (both visual and structural).

_blog_post_json.author: shi
_blog_post_json.title: shi at Mon 16 Jul 21:40:47 BST 2018 on ripley

blog/2018-07-16-22-41-15-ripley-shi._blog_post_body: Swanky Paint Alpha +11 features, 'A Pond', by Frances MacDonald in the Swanky32 palette. The tadpoles and dragonfly nymphs were a challenge to translate into large pixels. Even so, I like to think the Swan King is very much in his elements here :}

_blog_post_json.author: shi
_blog_post_json.title: shi at Mon 16 Jul 22:41:15 BST 2018 on ripley

blog/2018-07-17-16-44-52-ripley-shi._blog_post_body: Cleaned up the splash image, paying much closer attention to the source artwork and moved the text to another layer. The layer system has been spruced up significantly since the last experimental version but needs plenty more testing.

_blog_post_json.author: shi
_blog_post_json.title: shi at Tue 17 Jul 16:44:52 BST 2018 on ripley

blog/2018-07-20-04-01-45-ripley-shi._blog_post_body: Can graphs be functional and beautiful? I think so, yes.

_blog_post_json.author: shi
_blog_post_json.title: shi at Fri 20 Jul 04:01:45 BST 2018 on ripley

blog/2018-07-22-15-23-28-ripley-shi._blog_post_body: Akrobat font makes even the dullest graphs graphically interesting.

_blog_post_json.author: shi
_blog_post_json.title: shi at Sun 22 Jul 15:23:28 BST 2018 on ripley

blog/2018-07-23-16-28-12-ripley-shi._blog_post_body: Was not planning to take an entire week to do this but when has planning ever pan out when it comes to development? You can see the whole thing here - https://notshi.github.io/3x3x3/

_blog_post_json.author: shi
_blog_post_json.title: shi at Mon 23 Jul 16:28:12 BST 2018 on ripley

blog/2018-08-09-00-16-03-ripley-shi._blog_post_body: Finally had some time to make pixel versions of the Candy Ghost cast. The new #SwankyPaint UI feels really good to use - workflow feels more natural :}

_blog_post_json.author: shi
_blog_post_json.title: shi at Thu  9 Aug 00:22:02 BST 2018 on ripley

blog/2018-08-09-01-58-06-ripley-shi._blog_post_body: Testing out the new characters in-game. The few extra pixels added to the characters' head means assets need to be bigger now - the trees, for example, now look like baby trees, gah.

_blog_post_json.author: shi
_blog_post_json.title: shi at Thu  9 Aug 01:58:14 BST 2018 on ripley

blog/2018-08-09-02-02-00-ripley-shi._blog_post_body: Comparison with an old character - the smaller face meant details were compromised for a more abstract look and i was not at all happy with the lack of personality it conveyed. Much happier now ^.^=

_blog_post_json.author: shi
_blog_post_json.title: shi at Thu  9 Aug 02:02:09 BST 2018 on ripley

blog/2018-08-14-00-48-08-ripley-shi._blog_post_body: Characters for #sweetspace is getting along slowly - I've mostly been experimenting with dithering more than anything else. Also wondering if I should leave their attire the same as their 'human' counterpart or go for the homogenous alien uniform look.

_blog_post_json.author: shi
_blog_post_json.title: shi at Tue 14 Aug 00:48:17 BST 2018 on ripley

blog/2018-08-14-01-22-53-ripley-shi._blog_post_body: Wasn't sure if the old tiles would fit in with the new scenarios - some don't but the basic floor tiles still do, especially with the new dithering effects :}

_blog_post_json.author: shi
_blog_post_json.title: shi at Tue 14 Aug 01:23:01 BST 2018 on ripley

blog/2018-08-31-16-42-21-ripley-shi._blog_post_body: Setting up some information for our upcoming workshop tour accompanying the third Outlands 2018 installation. We'll be looking at a basic introduction into shader languages and how you can use this to explore and enhance your current practise as a musician and/or artist. The tour will take place around the UK over two weeks - join us? :}

_blog_post_json.author: shi
_blog_post_json.title: shi at Sun  2 Sep 19:53:13 BST 2018 on ripley

blog/2018-09-08-15-03-58-ripley-shi._blog_post_body: The weirdspace has oddly been my go to place to discover exquisite (unheard,forgotten,less known) masterpieces by women composers and authors. It's encouraging as well as disheartening to learn about the herstories but this only motivates me to keep pursuing my own. A big thanks go to Emily Hogstad for being an inspiration. Support her fantastic research on https://songofthelarkblog.com/

_blog_post_json.author: shi
_blog_post_json.title: shi at Fri 13 Jan 16:02:35 GMT 2023 on lily

blog/2023-01-13-16-14-12-lily-shi._blog_post_body: The recently updated MuseScore 4.0 looks and works so much better than it ever did. Samples sound less like midi and closer to a representation of someone playing an instrument. Really enjoying the physical squeaks and scrapes of a pizzicato or a reed between 'breaths'. Or possibly I am imagining these things!

_blog_post_json.author: shi
_blog_post_json.title: shi at Fri 13 Jan 16:14:13 GMT 2023 on lily

blog/2023-08-10-18-14-41-lily-shi._blog_post_body: i've recently taken over the Magpie News Sheet and it's been a re-learning experience. Sorta reminds me of the days when i did my first zine (in the 90s!) and getting contributions together. This is a wip of issue #9.

_blog_post_json.author: shi
_blog_post_json.title: shi at Thu 10 Aug 18:14:41 BST 2023 on lily

blog/2023-08-10-19-48-47-lily-shi._blog_post_body: Was invited for a fellowship by the bersee-Museum in Bremen to collaborate with Lisa Hilli, a Melanesian artist based in Australia. NEO Collections is a 4 year project about finding new ways of working with museum collections online and onsite. We created a space online where German culture is shared and collected through the lens of Pacific people's cultural values.

_blog_post_json.author: shi
_blog_post_json.title: shi at Thu 10 Aug 19:48:48 BST 2023 on lily

blog/2023-08-10-20-09-24-lily-shi._blog_post_body: Another NEO Collections Fellowship where we were tasked with looking into the details and processes of getting museums to digitise the data. This question was probably too ambitious to answer with the limited amount of time we were given; mostly to understand how different museums work and at what stage they were at in their digitisation journeys. The prototype was made in conjunction with bersee-Museum Bremen and Kunstmuseum Bochum.

_blog_post_json.author: shi
_blog_post_json.title: shi at Thu 10 Aug 20:09:25 BST 2023 on lily

blog/2023-08-11-15-15-26-lily-shi._blog_post_body: Think it's done, hopefully. Will probably need an extra set of eyes to check typos. Whenever i'm feeling the pressure of finishing a thing, the Final Countdown music starts playing in my head. i blame Dom for all those hackathon antics in Leeds, haha. Funny how random memories turn up that way :)

_blog_post_json.author: shi
_blog_post_json.title: shi at Fri 11 Aug 15:15:26 BST 2023 on lily

blog/2023-09-15-03-11-10-lily-shi._blog_post_body: New zine who dis? It's that time again - September means the local zine fair is happening again and each year, i try to make a new zine. This year it felt like i might skip it because the Magpie had taken quite a chunk of my time, mostly chasing printers. But a pal convinced me that i could just do a little one so here goes nothing.

_blog_post_json.author: shi
_blog_post_json.title: shi at Fri 15 Sep 03:11:11 BST 2023 on lily

blog/2023-09-17-16-29-05-lily-shi._blog_post_body: Really appreciate the latest version of inkscape with the flexible multipage systems and outline display modes. Support for the latter was probably there many versions ago but using it with multipage is fantastic. Here's hoping support for main (masters) document, page numbers, header and footer will follow suit.
